descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a few boxes on a black grid
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...keep it as same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...take main color and create border and frame it

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...colored boxes arranged in a pattern
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...should be the same as the input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...take the pattern and mirror it to the four corners like a reflection instead of a copy. One color will have 2 blocks of that color. Use that color to make a square around the grid using one for the start and the other for the end. This square will skip one block and then place a block all the way around the grid. If it encounters the patterns that you placed down skip that square

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...different colored boxes on a black background.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...continue the established pattern, leaving one black square between each colored square in the pattern.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...see several squares
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...follow the pattern of circles, creating a line and then making it symmetrycal

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...21X21 SIZE GRID
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...GIVE SOME DIFFERENT COLORS TO THE PATTERN
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...SIMILAR TO INPUT WITH DIFFERENT PATTERN

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black background and four colored grids.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...input size is same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...create border using first two color boxes with the second box to the right being the main boxes and first box is the corner boxes. The border should start one block to the right and one block down and leave a space in between each block and all the sides. The last two blocks should create a diagonal from the box on the corner and the diagonal should continue with last box

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... a few color boxes on  a black grid.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... keep it the same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... take the main color and create a border frame from the location it is in. take the color next to it and put it on the end point of the border frame. take the color box that is further away and copy that into the 4 directions making sure they are mirror images. A black box should be between each color box.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...random colored boxes on a black grid
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...it is similar
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...All boxes on the outside frame need to be black. One row in make the tiles the same color and the corners a different color. from the corners, go in 2 tiles towards the center with one color then another two tiles for another color.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... several different colored boxes.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... stays the same size.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... place a set of the colored boxes in each corner, but rotate the boxes so it is a mirror of the original set. For example, if a red box is nearest to the middle in the original set, then in the corners the red box will also be nearest to the middle. Next you will then create a border with the two same colored boxes that border another box. Just repeat those boxes away from the group until they go to another corner.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a few color boxes on a black grid
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...keep it the same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...take the main color and create a border frame from the location it is in.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... four boxes
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...it perhaps the same size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...symmetrical pattern to cover the grid

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a corner with a pattern
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...mirror the pattern to each corner. Connect the 4 corners with a line. The line is not solid but rather ever other square is left black. The color should be from the original pattern. Use the color that is 90 degree from the square or L-shaped pattern.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a few color boxes on a black grid.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...keep it the same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...take the main color and create a border frame from the location it is in.  take the color next to it and put it on the end point of the border frame.  take the color box that is following away and copy that into the 4 directions making sure they are mirror images.  A black box should be between each color box.
